rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses a moderate verb ('disappear') describing a consequence (product availability), not the direct impact of the virus using high-potency language.
Segment describes a future event ('will disappear'), not realised impact.
The segment reports disappearance of eggs but contains no explicit calming language.
The segment describes a measure ('Britain's hens have spent the last four months cooped up').
